item.title: S. 1930, Kennesaw Mountain National Battlefield Park Boundary Adjustment Act of 2015
item.description: As ordered reported by the Senate Committee on Energy and Natural Resources on July 13, 2016

summary.text:
Kennesaw Mountain National Battlefield Park Boundary Adjustment Act of 2015

Modifies the boundary of the Kennesaw Mountain National Battlefield Park in Georgia to include approximately eight acres identified as Wallis House and Harriston Hill.

Authorizes the Department of the Interior to acquire land or interests, by donation or exchange, from willing sellers only.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary has been expanded because action occurred on the measure.)

Kennesaw Mountain National Battlefield Park Boundary Adjustment Act of 2015

(Sec. 3) This bill modifies the boundary of the Kennesaw Mountain National Battlefield Park in Georgia to include approximately eight acres identified as Wallis House and Harriston Hill.

The Department of the Interior may acquire land or interests, by donation or exchange, from willing sellers only.

Interior shall administer acquired lands and interests as part of the park.

bill.title: Kennesaw Mountain National Battlefield Park Boundary Adjustment Act of 2015

item.title: Kennesaw Mountain National Battlefield Park Boundary Adjustment Act of 2015
A bill to adjust the boundary of the Kennesaw Mountain National Battlefield Park to include the Wallis House and Harriston Hill, and for other purposes.
Kennesaw Mountain National Battlefield Park Boundary Adjustment Act of 2015

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
